feels.name: Regret
feels.quote: Elizabeth, as she affectionately embraced her, whilst tears filled the eyes of both, lost not a moment in asking whether anything had been heard of the fugitives.

feels.name: Anguish
feels.quote: From Elizabeth’s thoughts it was never absent. Fixed there by the keenest of all anguish, self-reproach, she could find no interval of ease or forgetfulness.

feels.name: Gratitude
feels.quote: Elizabeth, though expecting no less, thanked him with tears of gratitude.

feels.name: Hope
feels.quote: The sanguine hope of good, however, which the benevolence of her heart suggested, had not yet deserted her; she still expected that it would all end well.

feels.name: Regret
feels.quote: received them exactly as might be expected; with tears and lamentations of regret, invectives against the villainous conduct of Wickham, and complaints of her own sufferings and ill-usage

feels.name: Fear
feels.quote: And now here’s Mr. Bennet gone away, and I know he will fight Wickham, wherever he meets him, and then he will be killed, and what is to become of us all?

causedByEvent.name: Fear of Mr. Bennet fighting Wickham

feels.name: Anxiety
feels.quote: The Collinses will turn us out, before he is cold in his grave; and if you are not kind to us, brother, I do not know what we shall do.
